Posts.Content: Hi I guess I'd just like other peoples thoughts, I am 11 weeks post mastectomy and immediate implant recon, ER postitve, grade 2, now taking Tamoxifen, firstly i feel so lucky to be here and i feel so ungrateful for worrying .... but I am ! Im a postive strong person, single Mum to 3 so I've had to be , but I am CONSTANTLY checking myself for symptoms of reoccurence, googling stuff, I spend ages when i go to bed checking my other boob, any minor thing I think oh god could it be back, is it cancer, is it the start of something ? I am driving myself nuts, like its consuming me - I have gone back to work, getting on with life, but i feel like this monster is at the back of my mind all of the time, hovering, waiting to come back . Does anyone have any advice or tips on how to stop turning into a crazy person !?
Posts.Title: sending myself crazy !

Posts.Content: Lol ..... I started back on Monday on a phased return, at this minute in time i am sat with my foot elevated and iced as i sprained it at the gym on Thursday evening ! Shbam is dangerous i tell thee !!! ;-) ......   I am a generally very positive smiley person, honest guv !!!  Any quiet spare time though and these thoughts creep in .... I'm sure it will get easier x
Posts.Title: sending myself crazy !

Posts.Content: Mark thanks for that, Mindfullness is something i really want to try, I do kind of do something similar when my mind wont let me be , going crazy with all the "what ifs ?"  I'm sure it will get less and less over time. x
Posts.Title: sending myself crazy !

Posts.Content: lol it does !  The sane me realises the probability of it returning is minimal, but the crazy me, well is just crazy ! I'm trying to keep a lid on it ..... I havent told anyone else how I feel. I have my first counselling session at the oncology centre on Wednesday so hopefully that will alleviate some fears I have ..... also hoping they don't decide to have me sectioned !!!!  ;-) Thanks for replying x

And it helps that I'm not the only one feeling like this , thats how it can seem sometimes . My family and friends have been awesome, but they just can't really know, how could they x

Posts.Title: sending myself crazy !

Posts.Content: I am 10 months post op - right mastectomy and immediate reconstruction with implant - no chemo or rads - I was EXTREMELY lucky so was started on Tamoxifen which I took for 6 months and could not cope with the side effects , which I discussed with my consultant who agreed to try me on Anastrazole as although I am only 46 I was plunged into surgical menopause last year so he agreed I was suitable to go onto AIs earlier - I have struggled with side effects with these drugs also to the point that I felt I was going insane - exhaustion, slow thought processes, low mood, absolutely zero libido, aching bones like a 90 year old - I literally was at the end of my tether and just needed to feel like ME again - so I stopped a month ago and feel so well , my brain is mine again - although now at the back of my mind is the worry that it will come back ..... I am desperately struggling to decide what to do for the best ....... I cant go back to feeling like a zombie again ........... any advice ? anyone else stopped and had a good outcome ? I cant tell my family I have stopped because they will not understand. When I broached the subject initially with my 16 year old she completely flipped and said she would leave home if I stopped the meds. I cant explain how unhappy and bloody terrible I felt - some days I found the most simple of tasks a struggle - yes Im worried about cancer coming back ! I just don't know what to do ......
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Thank you my lovely , i think i have already made my mind up really - it sounds so pathetic to me but I want quality of life - whats the friggin point of being here if i cant bloody do anything or enjoy anything - I am bloody miserable when on the drugs - I was coming home from work too tired to do anything with my daughter - just wanting to sleep - I am struggling anyway coming to terms with how I look without all of the other stuff - my self esteem is in my boots - before this i was so confident , outgoing, fun, - I am working hard to find the old me - I Thank you all so much for replying it really helps being able to talk to someone who understands x Big love and positive thoughts to you all chickeetas !!!!! x
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Hope its nothing serious when you go chick x I went back a few weeks ago thinking i had another lump - luckily it wasnt but it scares the shit out of you doesnt it when you've been through it all once already !  I cant go back to feeling like I did - but I will make an appointment to talk it through . Please let me know how you get on ? x
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Thank you for the cuddly !!  And the advice - I'm going to make an appointment with my consultant to find out extactly how much difference taking the AIs will make ! Is the amount of added protection worth it - I feel so selfish for complaining about this after not having to have chemo or rads and i am so grateful but i just cant go on feeling like that x
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Well folks I had a bone scan in nuclear med last Monday (one week ago) and now my breast consultant has requested a chest X-ray - any words of wisdom before I send myself mad !!!! Xx
Posts.Title: phlegmy cough sometimes dry and tickly - am I mad ?!?

Posts.Content: Hi - I feel daft asking but here goes - I had mastectomy and recon 1 year ago this January - no chemo or radiotherapy just hormone therapy - for the last 3 months Ive had a cough every day , usually worse at night but also daytime - not racking just phlegmy and sometimes dry and tickly - its driving me nuts ---- and now Im thinking should I tell my BC nurse ? Should I be worried ? Any advice please Xxxxx
Posts.Title: phlegmy cough sometimes dry and tickly - am I mad ?!?

Posts.Content: Hi I had right mastectomy and implant reconstruction  3 days ago and home now with one drain .... how much should I be doing !? I'm really concerned about moving the implant but realise I have to exercise to maintain range of movement and reduce risks of scar adhesions .... still quite light headed when I've been up on my feet but I'm a single mum of older teenagers, they can help but really?  Any advice x? Dos  and donts! ?? Xxx
Posts.Title: Home after op ........

Posts.Content: Hi Poppie - I had a right sided mastectomy and silicon implant in Jan 2017 - i had my first lipomodelling surgery today - sat on my sofa , feet up feeling a bit sore but feeling really positive ..... (I’m 46 and looking forward to the summer with a slightly flatter jelly belly lol) .......
Posts.Title: Can anyone tell me about their experience of lipomodelling please...

Posts.Content: Hi I’m a bit sore and tired today but not as bad as I expected. Some fat has been transferred near my armpit area and also to the centre of my chest well around the implant there - it’s my first op and he said I won’t see much change this time as the fat settles and also some is reabsorbed - so I’ll need another op in about 3 to 4 months time x
Posts.Title: Can anyone tell me about their experience of lipomodelling please...

Posts.Content: Just after some words of encouragement and reassurance I guess from people who have been through this .... I'm having a mastectomy and implant reconstruction to my right breast on Wednesday ... up until now I've been putting a brave face on and have been able to put it to the back of my mind but it's getting closer and closer and if I'm honest I'm really scared .  Anyone have any advice ... any do's or don't s ??? Xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Jane ... I guess I just want it over,  I'm scared of being in pain,  immobile,  loss of control everything! ! But yes the main thing is hopefully the cancer will be gone !!! Hope you're getting on well x ?
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Nicky  the pillows sound a good idea ... I've not slept well for a while now !! No surprise !!  My Bcn said buy a couple of supportive sports bras for now ?! I'm having under the muscle implants with the mesh sling.  The next big thing after that is waiting for the pathology to come back but I'm quite pragmatic about things now ... I try not to worry too much about what I can't control usually : / How are you doing now ? X Anna
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Hey  I'm home and not feeling too bad at all, few tears, more laughs , very tired !!! But so amazed and happy with how things have gone (so far ! ) Xxx When is your op ? Anna x
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: ps just to add ........... being able to talk to you girls on here is fantastic, i have lovely friends and family , I'm so lucky really but to talk to people who have been there/ going through similar stuff, well it means the world, it really does x
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Momo xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Ditto the control freak stuff !!! I'm scared of being trapped in the bed and not being mobile, how it'll feel, everything I guess ! How it'll look ..... (vain but true : ( ) .... but mostly I'll be glad my boring cancerous boob will be gone !!! ( That's what we call it .... my good boob is the "party boob" ! )   : )
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Hey Nicky .... major butterflies now it's almost here . Am I allowed to swear ? Scared shitless is a good northern phrase we use up here !!! My hospital is in Cottingham near Hull x It's great being able to come on here and ask questions and to know you're not the only one feeling what you're feeling !!!!  Xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!
